item.title: Avoiding boredom at all costs
item.description:
The worst part of coding for fun is perhaps coding the mundane stuff that gets in the way of cool new things. Clearly at this point is’s reasonable to import this trivial, mundane thing from a library. Well this past week’s npm controversry certianly displayed this idea taken to the extreme with things such as react breaking over left-pad.

I noticed an interesting debate about this. It’s around the question of if we’ve forgotten how to program :P

Here’s the original post that I found entertaining:

Have we forgotten how to Program?

And here’s a rebuttal that I quite agree with:

We haven’t forgotten how to program, we’re making the best of what we have
